Package net.cassite.style

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    A1ArrTransformer<R,T>
    Interface of classes to transform an array or an iterable object into another array
    A1FuncSup<T>
    Supporter of arrays and iterables
    A1Transformer<R,T,Coll extends java.util.Collection<R>>
    Transformer which transforms an array/iterable into a collection
    var
    All functions in Style tool box are provided both in Style and here.
    They are excatly the same.
    However sometimes you may not able to extends Style, then try implements var to get full support.
    But in this way, you are still not able to invoke methods directly from static methods.
    Anyway implements var still works in most cases.
    Also you may write code like this:
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    $
    Constants that's usually used with Style tool box
    Recommended context are provided, but they are not limited to those recommendations.
    ArrayFuncSup<T>
    Supporter of arrays
    ArrayFuncSup.ArrTransformer<R,T>
    Interface of classes to transform the array into another array
    ArrayFuncSup.Transformer<R,T,Coll extends java.util.Collection<R>>
    Transformer which transforms the array into a collection
    Async<R>
    Async supporter.
    AsyncGroup
    Joins results of a group of Async process.
    CollectionFuncSup<T>
    Supporter of collections
    ComparableFuncSup<T>
    Supporter of Comparable objects.
    Usually we don't need to know how much larger or smaller one object is than another
    We only need to know whether one is larger or smaller than the other.
    Readable methods are provided to determine larger/smaller/equal
    DateFuncSup
    Supporter of java.util.Date
    Provide Date add/subtract/toStringformat
    DateFuncSup.DateSeperator  
    def<R>
    an object representing a function
    Entry<K2,V2>
    Entry which formats a map from key to value
    ForSupport<N extends java.lang.Number>
    Supporter for For-to-step expression
    ForSupport.ToSupport<N extends java.lang.Number>
    Supporter for For-to-step expression
    IfBlock<T,INIT>
    Supporter for if expression
    IterableFuncSup<T>
    Supporter of iterables
    IterableFuncSup.ArrTransformer<R,T>
    Interface of classes to transform an iterable object into another array
    IterableFuncSup.Transformer<R,T,Coll extends java.util.Collection<R>>
    Transformer which transforms an iterable into a collection
    IteratorInfo<R>
    Info about current Iterator.
    It's a subclass of LoopInfo
    JSONLike<K,V>
    Provide a way of forming up a map in the way looks like JSON
    ListFuncSup<T>
    Supporter of lists
    LoopInfo<R>
    Info about current Iterator.
    It's a subclass of LoopInfo
    MapFuncSup<K,V>
    Supporter of maps
    MapFuncSup.TransformerArr<K,V,R>
    Transform a map into an array
    MapFuncSup.TransformerColl<K,V,R,Coll extends java.util.Collection<R>>
    Transformer which transforms a map into a collection
    MapFuncSup.TransformerMap<K,V,K2,V2,M extends java.util.Map<K2,V2>>
    Transforms a map into another one
    ptr<T>
    A container of objects, usually used when accessing a non-final value from inner classes.
    RegEx
    A Reg expression supporter that simplifies usage of RegEx
    and make it look like doing regex in JavaScript
    StringFuncSup
    Supporter for strings
    Style
    All functions in Style tool box are provided here.
    Let your class extends Style to avoid retyping Style. which makes your coding prettier
    SwitchBlock<T,R>
    Supporter for switch expression
    Note that it doesn't support break, because it doesn't go through other cases except the matched one.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    StyleRuntimeException
    A RuntimeException to simplify exception handling.
    it is recommended to create this exception using Style.$(Throwable)
